svc@... wrote:
> Dear all.
> At netarchive.dk (http://netarchive.dk/index-en.php), we modify the
> order.xml using templates before calling Heritrix.
> I would very much like to have tools for verifying that the modifcations
> performed are valid:
> It is easy enough to verify, that the resulting order.xml is valid xml,
> but I also like to know whether the classes in the order.xml exist and can
> be instantiated without actually starting the crawler.
> 
> Any suggestions are very welcome!

Here's one.  The crawler order file actually has an XML Schema.  It can 
be found at '/heritrix_settings.xsd' in a running crawler. I haven't 
tried order files against it in a while so might need updating.  Its a 
pretty loose validation but its a start.  You could extend this schema 
tightening up its validation.

As far as whether classes exist and if their loadable, how about a 
little bit of java code or a beanshell script that just walks the order 
file doing a newInstance on any class found?

Yours,
St.Ack
